intro: Erythroxylum cincinnatum, commonly known as the red mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is characterized by its striking red flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
